SurrogateMother.synopsis: These are the main dialogue states for Mayrina. They included - when the player rescues Mayrina, when the player kills the hag, when the illusion dissapates,  and her main dialogue states in the teahouse (bottom two branches.)

SurrogateMother_Dead.synopsis:
This occurs when Mayrina dies. There are multiple permutationinlcuding, but not limited to, you killed her brothers and/or her husband, she knows that one or more of these people are dead but doesn't blame you, you took her husband as a summon, and you know one of the brothers is dead but she doesn't hold you responsible. 

Sad and far away sound - except in parts when she knows you killed her family.

HusbandResurrected.synopsis: This is one of the key moments in the hag's region. The player raises Connor from the dead but without Mayrina present cannot control the Zombie that is now Connor. Panicked and afraid, the zombie struggles to call his wife's name before barelling forward - attacking the very person who raised them from the dead,

Husband.synopsis: Mayrina's husband has been resurrected - but he's not the man she married. He's a horrible and decomposing zombie.

SurrogateMother_AD_HagOccupied.synopsis: This is an edgecase in which the player talks to Mayrina when the hag isn't present. Mayrina is afraid, looking around for the hag - doesn't want to get into trouble. Sitting down in her chair.

ResurrectHusband.synopsis: The player has discovered a wand that will allow them to raise Mayrina's husband from the dead. Mayrina is standing by the coffin that holds her dead husband. When player raises Connor from the dead, the coffin door bursts open and he crawls out of it a zombie - unable to speak in anything other than moans and groans. Player can take the zombie as a summon, kill the zombie, or give the zombie to Mayrina.

StartScene.synopsis: This is the main hag dialogue. In it, you can ask about Mayrina (who is present) or make a deal to have your parasite removed. If you keep asking about Mayrina (twice), the hag will be furious and vanish Mayrina away while she deals with the 'busybody' - the player.If you agree to the tadpole deal, you must give up an eye (in the transformed dialogue).

PAD_AfterResurrection.synopsis: The player's found a wand in the Hag's lair and tried to use it to resurrect Mayrina's husband. Unfortunately, it was cursed and he only came back a zombie. The players reflect on using items from evil beings.
PAD_AfterResurrection.how_to_trigger: * load WLD_Main_A* oe HAG_SetupResurrection* talk to mayrine and resurrect her husband in the dialogue* VB plays after the Hag_Hagspawn_ResurrectHusband dialog emds if the husband became a zombie and wasn't lilled

AD_HagSurrogateMotherStartScene.synopsis: This fires between Mayrina and the Hag in the teahouse before the player has spoken to either of them.

PAD_FireplaceIllusion.synopsis: This triggers near the fireplace in the hag's home. If you see through the illusion, you realise that there is a passage way behind it. Otherwise you just see a pleasant fire.

SurrogateMother_AD_CorpseDugUp.synopsis: Triggers when Mayrina gets to the grave. In the top node the grave is empty. In the bottom the corpse is lying there for her to see. She leaves and does not return.

AD_HusbandGrave.synopsis: This occurs above the grave of Connor, Mayrina's husband. It was written by the hag and is a cruel jab.

automatic_ordering.reasoning: Some sessions describe mutually exclusive branches while others represent cause‐and‐effect events. For example, Mayrina’s dialogue in the normal branch (SurrogateMother) versus when she is dead (SurrogateMother_Dead) shows a mutually exclusive outcome. Likewise, the resurrection branch for Mayrina’s husband is split between outcomes: one branch shows him resurrected as a zombie in one way (Husband) and the other as a more uncontrolled, panicked zombie encounter (HusbandResurrected) – these are mutually exclusive. In the resurrection chain, the event ResurrectHusband (when the player uses the wand to raise the husband) must come before the additional reflection/dialogue PAD_AfterResurrection. Similarly, the early teahouse dialogue AD_HagSurrogateMotherStartScene (which occurs before the player speaks to the hag) logically precedes the main hag dialogue (StartScene). Finally, for the grave scenes, when Mayrina visits the grave (SurrogateMother_AD_CorpseDugUp) it leads into a scene above the grave where the hag issues a cruel remark (AD_HusbandGrave). Other sessions—like SurrogateMother_AD_HagOccupied and PAD_FireplaceIllusion—are context‐dependent edge cases without clear order constraints relative to the others. Based on these observations, the following ordering and exclusiveness rules can be deduced.
